oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Innovations in low input and organic dairy supply chains – what is acceptable in Europe?
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Nicholas, Phillipa
Mandolesi, Serena
Naspetti, Simona
Zanoli, Raffaele
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Dairy cattle
"Organics" in general
Social aspects
Produce chain management
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A Q-Method study was carried out as part of the Sustainable Organic and Low Input Dairying Project (SOLID) to investigate the acceptability of innovations in organic and low input dairy supply chains in the UK, FI, IT and BE.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Nicholas, Phillipa; Mandolesi, Serena; Naspetti, Simona and Zanoli, Raffaele (2014) Innovations in low input and organic dairy supply chains – what is acceptable in Europe? In: Rahmann, G. and Aksoy, U. (Eds.) Building Organic Bridges, Johann Heinrich von Thünen-Institut, Braunschweig, Germany, 4, Thuenen Report, no. 20, pp. 1167-1170.
